intro: Holodictyum ghiesbreghtii, commonly known as the Ghiesbreght's sea lettuce, is a marine green alga found in coastal regions. It belongs to the family Ulvaceae and is characterized by its flat, ribbon-like thallus that grows in dense mats on rocky substrates. The plant lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a simple structure composed of a single layer of cells. It thrives in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and plays a vital role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat for small marine organisms. Holodictyum ghiesbreghtii is often used in ecological studies to monitor water quality and environmental changes.
